p: Nigella sativa, an annual flowering plant of Ranunculaceae family, has been used in traditional medicine throughout Middle Eastern countries, such as Asia, Africa, and India, for various ailments. It is commonly used to treat asthma, 1, 2 but a recent study of N. sativa demonstrated the multiple mechanisms of actions for a range of therapeutic uses. These include its use in the remedy to treat hypercholesterolemia in menopausal women, with more benefits and less side effects than from other single pharmacological agents. 3
